name: clay brick production, extruded | clay brick | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/30175/documentation

This dataset describes the production of semi-mechanized clay bricks in the area of San José de Balzay and Racar in Ecuador. The dataset represents the production of 1 kg of brick, with the following characteristics: average weight of 6.06 kg and average dimensions of (19.5 x 38 x 12.5) cm (width x length x height), with 6 cavities of (4.75 x 5.25) cm. Data was obtained from measurements and information provided in the two factories visited, therefore the datasets contains weighted average values. Some data was calculated using literature values. ;The companies visits took place in March, May, and June 2022. This dataset was developed by Estefania Barros, Kristi Padrón, Jonnathan Aguirre and Juan Sebastian Martines, under the supervision of Prof. Dolores Sucozhañay and Prof. Paul Vanegas, from the Inclusive Circular Economy and Sustainable Development Research Group of the University of Cuenca (ECI) in the frame of the CEELA (Strengthening capacities for energy efficiency in buildings in Latin America) project with the support of the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC).;The dataset includes the whole manufacturing process of the clay brick. It does not include the packaging.

The activity starts with the reception of raw materials at the clay brick production site.

This dataset ends with the storage of the produced brick at the production site. This dataset includes the reception of raw materials, dosing, mixing, forming by extrusion and cutting, drying, firing, cooling and storage. The dataset does not include the packaging.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2392:Manufacture of clay building materials

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2022 (year of data collection) to 2023 (year of dataset compilation).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data was obtained by technical visits and data assessment in two factories of modern clay bricks located in San José de Balzay and Racar, Cuenca, Ecuador.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current production technology. This dataset corresponds to semi-automatized factories, which incorporates some machinery in their processes. However, one of the factories only uses diesel in the machinery, while the second factory uses diesel and electricity. The manufacturing process includes the reception of raw materials, dosing, mixing, forming by extrusion, drying, firing of wood, cooling and storage of bricks until they are sold directly to the clients or to intermediaries. The mix of raw material is deposited in a mill, then moved to an extruder formed by a mixer and a matrix.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data are calculated as a weighted average between the data collected at the two clay brick production factories. One, where diesel is used and other where diesel and electricity is used. See exchange comments for further details.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data gathered from two clay brick production plants through a process assessment in a technical visit. Azuay is the province where the factories from which data was obtained are located. This province represents 12% of the National Clay Brick Production in Ecuador, but the production process is very similar across Ecuador. Therefore, it is estimated that the dataset has a representativeness of 60%. Land occupation exchange is used as an estimate of infrastructure. Machinery use is accounted for through their fuel / electricity consumption.

exchanges.description: The dataset represents 1 kg of a hollow clay brick, with measured average dimensions (19.5 x 38 x 12.5) cm (width x length x height), with 6 cavities of (4.75 x 5.25) cm, and measured average mass of 6.06 kg.

flow.name: clay brick
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2392:Manufacture of clay building materials

exchanges.description: Calculated value. The wastewater was modelled as the water difference between the amount of rainwater used in the process together with the water contained in the clay, and the water evaporated from the brick after the firing process. The water is captured in a hole in the ground, where the mixing takes place. Therefore, the excess water is infiltrated by the soil and follows a natural process, where it eventually reaches groundwater or a water body.

flow.name: Water
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/unspecified

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Evaporated water is produced during two processes: 1) Combustion process, where water in wet mass amount in the wood chips gets evaporated (calculated as wood_fuel*water_in_wet_mass/1000); and 2) Drying process of the bricks (weight of a just made brick and a fired brick are considered).

flow.name: Water
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description: Estimated for infrastructure. Land occupation calculated as the land occupied by the production facility (0.25 ha) divided by the average annual production volume at the two visited facilities (1'401'451.885 kg clay brick extruded/year).

flow.name: Occupation, bare area (non-use)
flow.category: Elementary flows/Resource/land

exchanges.description: It's assumed that the lubricating oil must be disposed of after use (the lubricating oil is used to lube the machinery and does not become part of the product). Therefore, same amount as lubricating oil input is used to model the waste.

flow.name: waste mineral oil
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Calculated as the difference between the amount of inputs (wood fuel and oxygen) and outputs (CO2, CO, SO2, NOx, VOC, PM10 and water) from the firing process. Wood ash is produced from the combustion of wood during the firing process.

flow.name: wood ash mixture, pure
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

defaultProvider.name: market for wood ash mixture, pure | wood ash mixture, pure | Cutoff, U

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Volume of lubricating oil per kg of brick by the density of lubricating oil. Lubricating oil is used for the extruder machine. Maintenance is usually done every 3 months.

flow.name: lubricating oil
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/19:Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products/192:Manufacture of refined petroleum products/1920:Manufacture of refined petroleum products

defaultProvider.name: market for lubricating oil | lubricating oil | Cutoff, U
defaultProvider.category: C:Manufacturing/19:Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products/192:Manufacture of refined petroleum products/1920:Manufacture of refined petroleum products

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Carbon monoxide emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).

flow.name: Carbon monoxide, non-fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Monthly energy cost of the factory (40 USD/month) divided by the energy price (0.1 USD/kWh). This value is divided by the kg of bricks produced per month (154560 kg of bricks/month), to obtain the kWh of electricity per kg of clay brick. This value corresponds to the electricity used in the mill, a fan used for the firing process, and 4 lightbulbs used in the firing section of one of the factories.

flow.name: electricity, medium voltage
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

defaultProvider.name: market for electricity, medium voltage | electricity, medium voltage | Cutoff, U
defaultProvider.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the volume of diesel per kg of brick (0.00297 L/kg) by the heating value of diesel (35.86 MJ/L). Diesel is used in the machinery and internal transport.

flow.name: diesel, burned in building machine
flow.category: F:Construction/43:Specialized construction activities/431:Demolition and site preparation/4312:Site preparation

defaultProvider.name: market for diesel, burned in building machine | diesel, burned in building machine | Cutoff, U
defaultProvider.category: F:Construction/43:Specialized construction activities/431:Demolition and site preparation/4312:Site preparation

exchanges.description: Calculated value. This value represents the amount of various types of clay used for the production of 1 kg of clay brick, according to measurements and the information provided by the owners of the factories. The types of clay used are "tierra amarilla", "tierra fina" and "tierra roja".

flow.name: clay
flow.category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay

defaultProvider.category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Calculated from the total oxygen content of CO2 and CO.

flow.name: Oxygen
flow.category: Elementary flows/Resource/in air

exchanges.description: Calculated value.  The value represents the amount of eucalyptus wood used in the firing process for the production of 1 kg of clay brick as informed by the owners of the factories. Multiplying the volume of wood per kg of bricks (0.000208 m3/kg of clay brick) by wood density (730 kg wood/m3).

flow.name: wood chips, wet, measured as dry mass
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Sulfur dioxide emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Nitrogen oxides emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).

flow.name: Nitrogen oxides
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the number of damaged bricks by the brick mass (6.06 kg). This value is divided by the kg of bricks produced per firing process, to obtain the kg of damaged bricks per kg of clay brick. About 52 bricks are damaged in the oven, for each firing process, as informed by the owner of one of the factories is considered. These bricks are used to fill holes in the ground. Therefore, the disposal is modelled as open dumping.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Carbon dioxide emission is produced from the combustion of the firing process. Reference: Alvear, P., & Palomeque, R. (2017). Análisis del inventario del ciclo de vida del ladrillo utilizado en la ciudad de Cuenca: aspectos energéticos, medio ambientales, sociales, económicos y culturales. University of Cuenca, Cuenca, Ecuador (Bachelor's thesis).

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Particulate matter emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. PM10 emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Particulate matter is < 10 um. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).

Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. VOC emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).
